title: Which K-pop groups don't have a leader? - Quora

response.answer_text: NCT Dream:  Because this NCT unit is rotational, the group does not have an official leader. BLACKPINK:  The BLACKPINK members decided not to appoint a leader because all of them have trained together for multiple years like close friends. K.A.R.D:  The co-ed group K.A.R.D debuted without an official leader, possibly because all members demonstrate strong leadership. iKON:  iKON’s original leader was B.I, but he decided to leave the group in 2019 upon drug allegations. Although he has been proven innocent following negative test results, he has yet to return. Secret Number:  Rookie girl group Secret Number, which recently debuted in May 2020, revealed that they don’t have a leader. 2PM:  Upon their debut, Jay Park was appointed leader of 2PM. After his departure, the group never found a new leader. ONEUS:  Each member is in charge of a specific position, but none of the members is the leader. Fans often mistake Ravn as the leader because he is the eldest and usually answers questions for the group in interviews, but he is not an official leader. JYJ:  The members of JYJ, who were all originally members of TVXQ, left SM Entertainment after disputes. They never ended up appointing a leader. Miss A:  Although miss A has disbanded, they were one of the first groups to make their debut without an official leader AB6IX:  Following his DUI incident, leader Youngmin decided to leave AB6IX to prevent further harm to the group. Credits: K-Pop groups without an official leader

As a counter-example, I’ll name a group that was leader-less, but had to add one.  This was U-KISS (Dongho, Eli, Kevin, Kibum, Soohyun and Xander) back in 2008, when they just debuted. They were a group with a youthful image and didn’t have a leader. The company added another member (Kiseop) later in the year, and that lineup remained for two years. In 2011, their company announced that the members Kibum, who “wanted to focus on his acting career”, and Xander, who had “personal reasons, mainly his studies”, “decided” to suspend their contracts. Notice the quotes? Those former members revealed they were forced to end their contracts so the group could have two more members.  (Hoon, Kiseop, Eli, Soohyun, Kevin, Dongho and AJ) This naturally caused inestability whithin the group, distrust in the company, paranoia and miscommunication. Soohyun, the eldest and most experienced member was appointed as the leader as a way to manage this situation. From that point onwards, he became a pillar in the group, mainly for internal communication within the group and to the company (as it’s normally a leader’s duty). Now, after many years, another new member (Jun in 2014), suspended contracts, actually leaving for studying, marriages, children, a divorce, a survival show, not renewed contracts, and military service, Soohyun is the only original member left in a three member lineup (Soohyun, Hoon, Jun). Thanks to social media, though, we know that many of the members are in good terms.
